name: High Plank
how_to_perform:
1. Start by kneeling on the floor. Place your hands shoulder-width apart on the floor directly under your shoulders, fingers pointed forward. 
2. Extend your legs straight behind you, resting on the balls of your feet. Your body should form a straight line from your head to your heels. 
3. Engage your core by pulling your navel in towards your spine. Make sure your hips are not sagging or lifted too high. 
4. Keep your neck in a neutral position by looking down at the floor; avoid looking up or letting your head hang down. 
5. Hold this position for the desired amount of time, ensuring your form remains correct. 
6. To release, gently lower your knees to the floor and come to a resting position.
short_summary: The high plank is a core strengthening exercise that involves holding a push-up position.
